docs.snippet: SOME eleven months ago, after years of yearning, conflict broke out between Bolivia and Paraguay in the unmeasured wilderness of the Chaco Boreal. Three months later Peru and Colombia became involved in armed conflict in the upper reaches of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: SOME eleven months ago, after years of yearning, conflict broke out between Bolivia and Paraguay in the unmeasured wilderness of the Chaco Boreal. Three months later Peru and Colombia became involved in armed conflict in the upper reaches of the Amazon.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA'S CONFLICTS ENTERING UPON A NEW PHASE; Legal War Between Bolivia and Paraguay and the Rivalry of Peru and Colombia Touch the Interests of the Other Republics

docs.snippet: While the advance in the listed bond market yesterday was not so sharp as that of stocks, many representative domestic corporation bonds climbed 1 to more than 3 points on the Stock Exchange and a few issues did even better. Foreign loans were steady...
docs.lead_paragraph: While the advance in the listed bond market yesterday was not so sharp as that of stocks, many representative domestic corporation bonds climbed 1 to more than 3 points on the Stock Exchange and a few issues did even better. Foreign loans were steady to firm and United States Government bonds held their ground well in the two-hour trading period.

headline.main: DOMESTIC BONDS IN SHARP ADVANCE; Many Corporation Issues Up 1 to 3 Points on Stock Ex- change -- Federal List Firm. FOREIGN SECTION STEADY German Loans Active, With Small Price Changes -- Trend Upward on Curb, With Peaks for 1933.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, May 29. -- The Boerse opened the week in a mood of watchful waiting which reduced business to a minimum, but quotations were fairly steady. Somewhat weak at the beginning, the market rallied near the close. Financial circles have become very...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, May 29. -- The Boerse opened the week in a mood of watchful waiting which reduced business to a minimum, but quotations were fairly steady. Somewhat weak at the beginning, the market rallied near the close. Financial circles have become very skeptical regarding both the disarmament and economic conferences and the impending meeting of Germany's creditors in Berlin is another cause for caution.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 31 -- Exports declined in April to twentytwo of the forty foreign markets of this country and with a combined value of $105,063,412 were about $3,000,000 less than for the preceding month, according to an analysis given out today by...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 31 -- Exports declined in April to twentytwo of the forty foreign markets of this country and with a combined value of $105,063,412 were about $3,000,000 less than for the preceding month, according to an analysis given out today by the Commerce Department.

headline.main: EXPORTS TO EUROPE INCREASED IN APRIL; Shipments to 22 of Foreign Markets Fell Below the March Figures. IMPORTS WERE ALSO DOWN Commerce Department Summary Shows Better Business Tone in South America and Canada.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Gold movements in May were reduced to a minimum, the net change having been a grain of $710,200 in the holdings of the United States. The additional metal came from Latin America and China and through a reduction in earmarked gold not shipped abroad....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gold movements in May were reduced to a minimum, the net change having been a grain of $710,200 in the holdings of the United States. The additional metal came from Latin America and China and through a reduction in earmarked gold not shipped abroad. The upturn compared with one of $21.938,000 in April and a loss of $221,262,300 in May, 1932.
docs.abstract: Rept for May on imports and exports

headline.main: SMALL GAIN IN GOLD MADE HERE IN MAY; Upturn of $710,200 Resulted From Imports and Drop in Earmarked Metal.

docs.snippet: WHEN short waves stream out from England to be intercepted on the eastern edge of the American continent, the impulses must be amplified and "patched up" electrically before being fed into coast-to-coast broadcasting networks to which many ears may...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN short waves stream out from England to be intercepted on the eastern edge of the American continent, the impulses must be amplified and "patched up" electrically before being fed into coast-to-coast broadcasting networks to which many ears may be attuned.

headline.main: THE ART OF SOUND ALCHEMY; King George to Use Empire's Far-Flung Radio System in Welcome to Economic Conference Delegates
